definitions.definition: Of, or relating to geopolitics.
The bluish-green colour of the sea.
A bluish-green variety of beryl.
Of a bluish-green colour.
A person, especially a female, who has hair of this colour.
A cocktail comprising one part vodka to two parts cherry brandy to three parts cola topped with a dash of cream and stirred gently with a swizzle stick before serving.
An uncommon hair colour that is a combination of blonde and red.
A telephone call to awaken someone at a certain time, especially one requested by the person while staying at a hotel.
definitions.example: She requested a five a.m. wake-up call from the front desk.

definitions.definition: An alert, reminder, or call to action caused by a dramatic event.
definitions.example: The recent deaths should serve as a wake-up call to others at risk.

definitions.definition: One who assesses a property for tax or insurance evaluation.
A specialist who assists the court in determining a matter.
A civil servant entrusted with checking the veracity of data and criteria used by a taxpayer to complete a tax return.
One who assesses a project for cost evaluation.
(Oxford University) An official responsible for student welfare.
A brand name that is well known to the great majority of households.
A genericized trademark.
A very well-known public figure.
A male school crossing attendant.
A domesticated animal used to carry heavy items.
A wild animal that lives and hunts in packs
Any of the 114 chapters of the Qur'an.
The sap of the palmyra or of the coconut palm, palm wine.
The phase of the moon when it is in opposition to the sun.
The moon when it is in opposition to the sun.
A third anniversary.
A plant that requires three years to complete its life-cycle.
Happening every three years.
definitions.example: triennial elections

definitions.definition: Lasting for three years.
definitions.example: triennial parliaments; a triennial reign

definitions.definition: Of, pertaining to, or in the region of, the pelvis
definitions.example: pelvic cellulitis

definitions.definition: One who reforms, or who works for reform.
(history) One who was involved in the Reformation.
(chemical engineering, fuel cells) A device which converts hydrocarbons into a hydrogen-rich mixture of gases.
(chemical engineering) A device used to convert petroleum refinery naphthas, typically having low octane ratings, into high-octane liquid products called reformates.
Water with a very low content of dissolved salt, as opposed to brackish water or salt water.
A body of fresh water
Living in fresh water.
definitions.example: The trout is a freshwater fish.

definitions.definition: Consisting of fresh water.
definitions.example: Lake Baikal is the world's largest freshwater lake in terms of volume.

definitions.definition: Unskilled as a seaman.
definitions.example: a freshwater sailor

definitions.definition: Neoclassical, in reference to U.S. macroeconomics and economics departments near the Great Lakes.
The formulation of policies.
A dessert made from stale bread, suet, egg, sugar or golden syrup, spices, and dried fruit.
A retail business selling newspapers, magazines, and stationery; a stationer.
The proprietor of such a business.
The state or quality of being like or alike
Appearance or form; guise.
definitions.example: A foe in the likeness of a friend

definitions.definition: That which closely resembles; a portrait.
definitions.example: How he looked, the likenesses of him which still remain enable us to imagine.

definitions.definition: To depict.
Shy, extremely humble and modest; making oneself seem unnoticeable.
definitions.example: Clark Kent's self-effacing behavior is to purposefully make people ignore him.

definitions.definition: Being a generalization of a perfect number. For a given natural number k, a number n is called k-perfect (or k-fold perfect) iff the sum of all positive divisors of n (the divisor function, σ(n)) is equal to kn.
The pluperfect tense.
A verb in this tense.
More than perfect.
(grammar) Pertaining to action completed before or at the same time as another.
Relating to a certain type of graph, complying with the theorem (pluperfect graph theorem) discovered by D. R. Fulkerson in 1970.
Used as an intensifier in various interjections.
definitions.example: What in the pluperfect hell is going on here?!

definitions.definition: A person who lends money and charges interest, especially one who is not part of the official financial industry
The highest point.
A tall, sharp and craggy rock or mountain.
An all-time high; a point of greatest achievement or success.
An upright member, generally ending in a small spire, used to finish a buttress, to constitute a part in a proportion, as where pinnacles flank a gable or spire.
To put something on a pinnacle.
To build or furnish with a pinnacle or pinnacles.
An unpaced race in which riders or teams leaving at regular intervals are timed over a preset course or distance, the winner being the rider or team to finish in the fastest time.
Any competitive event in which competitors are timed rather than racing against each other.
The rigging of a sailing ship or other such craft.
Special equipment or gear used for a particular purpose.
definitions.example: The climbers each had a different rig for climbing that particular rockface.

definitions.definition: A large truck such as a semi-tractor.
definitions.example: Every rig at the truckstop had custom-made mud-flaps.

definitions.definition: The special apparatus used for drilling wells.
A costume or an outfit.
definitions.example: My sister and I always made our own rigs for Halloween.

definitions.definition: A computer case, often modified for looks.
An imperfectly castrated horse, sheep etc.
Radio equipment, especially a citizen's band transceiver.
A model outfitted with parameterized controls for animation.
To fit out with a harness or other equipment.
To equip and fit (a ship) with sails, shrouds, and yards.
To dress or clothe in some costume.
To make or construct something in haste or in a makeshift manner.
definitions.example: rig up a makeshift shelter

definitions.definition: To manipulate something dishonestly for personal gain or discriminatory purposes.
definitions.example: to rig an election

definitions.definition: To make free with; hence, to steal; to pilfer.
To outfit a model with controls for animation.
A ridge.
A wanton; one given to unbecoming conduct.
A promiscuous woman.
A sportive or unbecoming trick; a frolic.
A blast of wind.
To play the wanton; to act in an unbecoming manner; to play tricks.
An algebraic structure similar to a ring, but without the requirement that every element have an additive inverse.
A ball or pad of soft material used for the application of cosmetic powder to the face.
The party that brings a civil lawsuit against another; the plaintiff.
An alleged victim in a criminal investigation or trial.
One who makes complaint.
Inferior in quality or standing.
definitions.example: He complained he felt like a second-class citizen, but everyone felt put upon that day.

definitions.definition: Any medicine or other agent that relieves pain
A source of relaxation or comfort
(pharmaceutical effect) capable of soothing or eliminating pain
Soothing or relaxing
definitions.example: Classical music is rather anodyne.

definitions.definition: (by extension) noncontentious, blandly agreeable, unlikely to cause offence or debate
A written work, usually a novel, which is sufficiently interesting or suspenseful to keep the reader 'turning the pages'.
Any of the predatory amphibious reptiles of the family Crocodylidae; a crocodilian, any species of the order Crocodilia, which also includes the alligators, caimans and gavials.
A long line or procession of people (especially children) walking together.
A fallacious dilemma, mythically supposed to have been first used by a crocodile.
To speak one's native language at an Esperanto-language gathering, rather than Esperanto.
An esplanade.
Prone to glitches.
definitions.example: a glitchy computer

definitions.definition: Characteristic of glitch or error.
definitions.example: electronic music with glitchy sounds

definitions.definition: A room for receiving and entertaining guests.
One who is narrow-mindedly devoted to one's own ideas and groups, and intolerant of (people of) differing ideas, races, genders, religions, politics, etc.
One who is overly pious in matters of religion, often hypocritically or else superstitiously so.
A sparkling white wine made from a blend of grapes, especially Chardonnay and pinot, produced in Champagne, France, by the méthode champenoise.
Any sparkling wine made by the méthode champenoise.
Any sparkling white wine.
A glass of champagne.
A very pale brownish-gold colour, similar to that of champagne.
To ply or treat with champagne.
To drink champagne.
Of a very pale brownish-gold colour, similar to that of champagne.
A Hindu temple.
The supporting part of a structure (either physical or organizational; the foundation).
The earth or gravel that the railway tracks are embedded in.
A written schedule of activities for a vacation or road trip.
A route or proposed route of a journey.
An account or record of a journey.
A guidebook for travellers.
Itinerant; travelling from place to place; done on a journey
To whet the appetite.
That appeals to, or stimulates the appetite.
definitions.example: This food looks so appetizing.

definitions.definition: (by extension) Appealing or enticing.
A strong canvas bag used for the transportation of mail
A smaller bag, slung from the shoulders, used for the delivery of mail
Excessively nervous, excited, tense, angry, anxious, or upset; overemotional; very uneasy.
Elaborate; overdone.
A new set of hounds.
A new set of horses kept along a specific route so that they can replace animals that are tired.
(by extension) A new set of anything.
A series of vehicles travelling in sequence.
A track and field discipline where runners take turns in carrying a baton from start to finish. Most common events are 4x100 meter and 4x400 meter competitions.
An electrical actuator that allows a relatively small electrical voltage or current to control a larger voltage or current.
To release a new set of hounds.
To place (people or horses) in relays, such that one can take over from another.
To take on a new relay of horses; to change horses.
To pass on or transfer (information).
definitions.example: Can you relay this message to John?

definitions.definition: To lay (for example, flooring or railroad track) again.
definitions.example: He had to re-lay the tiles because the cement was too dry.

definitions.definition: (in Europe) A transfer of funds between different account holders, carried out by the bank according to payer's written instructions.
An unemployment benefit cheque.
To transfer funds between different account holders, carried out by the bank according to payer's written instructions.
The conversion of atmospheric nitrogen into ammonia and organic derivatives, by natural means, especially such conversion, by microorganisms in the soil, into a form that can be assimilated by plants
A strong, abrupt rush of wind.
(by extension) Any rush or outburst (of water, emotion, etc.).
To blow in gusts.
The physiological faculty of taste.
Relish, enjoyment, appreciation.
definitions.example: 1942: ‘Yes, indeed,’ said Sava with solemn gust. — Rebecca West, Black Lamb and Grey Falcon (Canongate 2006, p. 1050)

definitions.definition: Intellectual taste; fancy.
To taste.
To have a relish for.
A play on words on a phrase in which the initial (usually consonantal) sounds of two or more of the main words are transposed.
The cry of a cat.
The drug mephedrone.
Of a cat, to make its cry.
A feast; a hearty meal.
Powder obtained by grinding or milling cereal grains, especially wheat, or other foodstuffs such as soybeans and potatoes, and used to bake bread, cakes, and pastry.

The food made by grinding and bolting cleaned wheat (not durum or red durum) until it meets specified levels of fineness, dryness and freedom from bran and germ, also containing any of certain enzymes, ascorbic acid and certain bleaching agents.
Powder of other material.
definitions.example: mustard flour

definitions.definition: A colorful, conspicuous structure associated with angiosperms, frequently scented and attracting various insects, and which may or may not be used for sexual reproduction.
A reproductive structure in angiosperms (flowering plants), often conspicuously colourful and typically including sepals, petals, and either or both stamens and/or a pistil.
A plant that bears flowers, especially a plant that is small and lacks wood.
definitions.example: We transplanted the flowers to a larger pot.

definitions.definition: (usually with in) Of plants, a state of bearing blooms.
definitions.example: The dogwoods are in flower this week.

definitions.definition: (hypocoristic) The vulva, especially the labia majora.
The best examples or representatives of a group.
definitions.example: We selected the flower of the applicants.

definitions.definition: The best state of things; the prime.
definitions.example: She was in the flower of her life.

definitions.definition: Flour.
(in the plural) A substance in the form of a powder, especially when condensed from sublimation.
definitions.example: the flowers of sulphur

definitions.definition: A figure of speech; an ornament of style.
Ornamental type used chiefly for borders around pages, cards, etc.
(in the plural) Menstrual discharges.
Something that flows, such as a river.
Refined flour made solely of the endosperm of the grain, i.e. without germ and bran, often chemically whitened.
A garden tool with a handle and a flat blade for digging. Not to be confused with a shovel which is used for moving earth or other materials.
A playing card marked with the symbol ♠.

definitions.definition: A black person.
A cutting instrument used in flensing a whale.
To turn over soil with a spade to loosen the ground for planting.
A hart or stag three years old.
A castrated man or animal.
To grasp or grip firmly.
definitions.example: Hold on tightly to the railing.

definitions.definition: To keep; to store something for someone.
definitions.example: Hold on to my umbrella while I ride the roller coaster.

definitions.definition: Wait a short while.
definitions.example: Hold on while I get my coat.

definitions.definition: To remain loyal.
definitions.example: He didn't give up his fandom when others did; he held on.

definitions.definition: To persist.
A scheme offering recreational activities for children.
The state or fact of being turbulent or agitated; tempestuousness, disturbance.
Disturbance in a gas or fluid, characterized by evidence of internal motion or unrest.
Specifically, a state of agitation or disturbance in the air which is disruptive to an aircraft.
An instance or type of such state or disturbance.
A type of very sweet candy or confection, usually made from sugar, butter, and milk or cream. Often used in the US synonymously with chocolate fudge.
definitions.example: Have you tried the vanilla fudge? It's delicious!

definitions.definition: Light or frothy nonsense.
A deliberately misleading or vague answer.
A made-up story.
A less than perfect decision or solution; an attempt to fix an incorrect solution after the fact.
To try to avoid giving a direct answer.
definitions.example: When I asked them if they had been at the party, they fudged.

definitions.definition: To alter something from its true state, as to hide a flaw or uncertainty. Always deliberate, but not necessarily dishonest or immoral.
definitions.example: Do you fudge your age?

definitions.definition: To botch or bungle something.
To cheat, especially in the game of marbles.
(minced oath) Used in place of fuck.
Nonsense; tommyrot.
To conclude; to quit or stop an activity, especially after applying oneself to it for a significant period of time.
To declare debts resolved to one another

Any of various parrots of the genera Ara, Anodorhynchus, Cyanopsitta, Orthopsittaca, Primolius and Diopsittaca of Central and South America, including the largest parrots and characterized by long sabre-shaped tails, curved powerful bills, and usually brilliant plumage.
To plant or sow an area with seeds.
definitions.example: I seeded my lawn with bluegrass.

definitions.definition: To cover thinly with something scattered; to ornament with seedlike decorations.
To start; to provide, assign or determine the initial resources for, position of, state of.
definitions.example: A venture capitalist seeds young companies.

definitions.definition: To allocate a seeding to a competitor.
To leave (files) available for others to download through peer-to-peer file sharing protocols (e.g. BitTorrent).
To be qualified to compete, especially in a quarter-final, semi-final or final.
definitions.example: The tennis player seeded into the quarters.

definitions.definition: To produce seed.
To grow to maturity.
To ejaculate inside the penetratee during intercourse, especially in the rectum.
Bearing seed.
Sown.
Being a seed; being in a seed position
(of a rose) Having the stamens / seeds indicated
A newly sprouted leaf or blossom that has not yet unfolded.
definitions.example: After a long, cold winter, the trees finally began to produce buds.

definitions.definition: Something that has begun to develop.
definitions.example: breast buds

definitions.definition: A small rounded body in the process of splitting from an organism, which may grow into a genetically identical new organism.
definitions.example: In this slide, you can see a yeast cell forming buds.

definitions.definition: (usually uncountable) Potent cannabis taken from the flowering part of the plant (the “bud”), or marijuana generally.
definitions.example: Hey bro, want to smoke some bud?

definitions.definition: A weaned calf in its first year, so called because the horns are then beginning to bud.
(term of endearment) A pretty young girl.
To form buds.
definitions.example: The trees are finally starting to bud.

definitions.definition: To reproduce by splitting off buds.
definitions.example: Yeast reproduces by budding.

definitions.definition: To begin to grow, or to issue from a stock in the manner of a bud, as a horn.
To be like a bud in respect to youth and freshness, or growth and promise.
To put forth as a bud.
To graft by inserting a bud under the bark of another tree.
Buddy, friend.
definitions.example: I like to hang out with my buds on Saturday night.

definitions.definition: Used to address a male
Mental or emotional strength that enables courage in the face of adversity.
Physical strength.
An increase; something that accumulates, especially an amount of money that periodically accumulates for a specific purpose
From the creditor's viewpoint, a charge incurred in one accounting period that has not been, but is to be, paid by the end of it.
Small square parcels of pasta filled with meat, cheese, spinach etc.
A dish made with ravioli.
By analogy, similar dishes/pastas from non-Italian cuisines.
(chiefly in the plural) A single, large parcel of pasta with a filling, served with a sauce.
A liquor made of rum and molasses.
Counterfeit or fake; not genuine.
Undesirable or harmful.
Incorrect, useless, or broken.

Of a totally fictitious issue printed for collectors, often issued on behalf of a non-existent territory or country (not to be confused with forgery, which is an illegitimate copy of a genuine stamp).
Based on false or misleading information or unjustified assumptions.
definitions.example: bogus laws

definitions.definition: Handicraft
The class of subjects for study that rely upon experimentation and observation.
To engage in handcraft or handicraft.
A female fox.
A malicious, quarrelsome or temperamental woman.
A racy or salacious woman.
A wife who has sex with other men with her husband's consent.
The line along one's forehead where hair starts growing.
definitions.example: It's just a receding hairline — it's not like you're going bald.

definitions.definition: A very thin line in writing, drawing, or typography.
A fishing line made from hair.
A very thin fissure.
definitions.example: While inspecting the new house, we found a few hairlines in one of the walls.

definitions.definition: Very thin, as thin as a hair
definitions.example: There was a hairline crack in the airplane's wing.

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to a serf, peasant, or rustic.
Rude, surly, ungracious.
Stingy or grudging.
(of soil) Difficult to till, lacking pliancy; unmanageable.
A glacial period (colloquially known as an ice age).
Of, or relating to glaciers.
definitions.example: Wang Shijin is a glacier expert and director of the Yulong Snow Mountain Glacial and Environmental Observation Research Station.

definitions.definition: Very slow.
Cold and icy.
definitions.example: After the rain and frost, the pavements were glacial.

definitions.definition: Having the appearance of ice.
definitions.example: On cold days, glacial acetic acid will freeze in the bottle.

definitions.definition: Cool and unfriendly.
definitions.example: He gave me a glacial stare.

definitions.definition: A supporter of unilateralism.
Supporting or advocating unilateralism
A person who subscribes to neoliberalism.
In accordance with, or subscribing to, neoliberalism.
An illustration that is on the page before the title page of a book, a section of one, or a magazine.
The title page of a book.
A façade, especially an ornamental one.
A small ornamental pediment, especially at the top of a window or door.
To supply with a frontispiece.
definitions.example: The novel was frontispieced with a portrait of the author.

definitions.definition: A musical note four beats long in 4/4 time; a whole note (US)
To divide into or assign sections or areas.
definitions.example: Please zone off our staging area, a section for each group.

definitions.definition: To define the property use classification of an area.
definitions.example: This area was zoned for industrial use.

definitions.definition: To enter a daydream state temporarily, for instance as a result of boredom, fatigue, or intoxication; to doze off.
definitions.example: Everyone just put their goddamn heads together and zoned. (Byron Coley, liner notes for the album "Piece for Jetsun Dolma" by Thurston Moore)

definitions.definition: To girdle or encircle.
